overall_assessment: Strong analysis with compelling metrics and clear value proposition. Needs more specific unit economics, stronger competitive moat articulation, and clearer path to $100M+ revenue.
strengths: Excellent opening hook with specific '$200 billion annual mistake festival' statistic
Clear 10x improvement with 73% reduction in furniture returns
Strong real user pain example with Sarah Chen's $3,700 loss
Good use of 2024-2025 data sources throughout
Solid bottom-up TAM calculation showing $12.3B addressable market
Clear timing argument with iPhone 15 Pro LiDAR and ARKit 6

critical_issues.issue: Path to $100M+ revenue not clearly visible
critical_issues.suggestion: At 500K MAU generating $27M ARR, show how to reach $100M. Add calculation: 2M MAU × $1,200 AOV × 2.3 purchases/year × 15% commission = $103M ARR. Include user acquisition timeline.

critical_issues.issue: Unfair advantage not compelling enough against well-funded competitors
critical_issues.suggestion: Patents pending isn't enough. Need stronger network effects or data advantage. Emphasize: 'Every room scanned improves our AI for all users. After 100K rooms, our placement accuracy becomes unbeatable. Competitors starting now are 2 years behind.'

improvements.issue: CAC and LTV need more detail and validation
improvements.suggestion: Break down the $12 CAC: Instagram ads at $3 CPM, 0.5% CTR, 8% install rate = $12 CAC. For LTV, show retention curve: 60% Y1, 40% Y2, 20% Y3 with 2.3 purchases/year at $180 commission each.

improvements.issue: Missing specific proof points beyond Wayfair pilot
improvements.suggestion: Add more validation: 'Beta test with 500 users: 73% made a purchase within 30 days, average session time 47 minutes, NPS score of 72.' Include specific user testimonials.

improvements.issue: 'Why hasn't Amazon done this?' not directly addressed
improvements.suggestion: Add: 'Amazon tried AR View in 2017 but shut it down - they lack the specialized AR talent and multi-retailer marketplace model we've built. Their DNA is logistics, not immersive experiences.'

improvements.issue: AR furniture market size jump from $2.1B to $14.8B needs more support
improvements.suggestion: Add source for 47% CAGR projection or calculate bottom-up: 'With 340M AR-capable phones × 30% adoption × $150 annual AR commerce spend = $15.3B by 2028.'

minor_suggestions.issue: Pokemon Go reference might date the pitch
minor_suggestions.suggestion: Consider 'Instagram filters for furniture shopping' as more current analogy

minor_suggestions.issue: Series A metrics not specific enough
minor_suggestions.suggestion: Define Series A readiness: '$3M ARR run rate, 15% MoM growth, CAC payback < 6 months, 70% gross margins'

minor_suggestions.issue: Vision Pro reference might be seen as hype
minor_suggestions.suggestion: Focus on concrete adoption metrics: '340 million AR-capable phones in market' is stronger than Vision Pro hype

iteration_reason: Analysis needs critical improvements to show clear path to $100M+ revenue and strengthen competitive moat. The unfair advantage isn't compelling enough for investors, and unit economics need more validation. These issues should be addressed in the next iteration.
